Posts.Signature: Age: 36 (29 at diagnosis) Diagnosis: Burkitt's lymphoma, sporadic type (originally misdiagnosed as FL, then DLBCL) Stage: 2B, bulky disease Treatment: Began 8 cycles of R-CHOP 14 on 21 May 2010 + protocol. Discontinued treatment after 6 cycles due to misdiagnosis and switched to 3 cycles of R-CODOX-M/R-IVAC on 20 August 2010. Ended treatment with BEAM+Autologous SCT on 1 October 2010. In remission ever since. My story: [url]http://www.cancerforums.net/threads/13165-NHL-at-29-years-old-My-story[/url]
Posts.Title: Question for the Aussies

Posts.Content: Hi guys, A friend of mine is currently at Royal North Shore Hospital for suspected metastatic breast cancer (hip, spine, liver). Is this a top-notch treatment facility? Any other recommendations in Sydney area? So far it seems to me that she is in good hands, but wanted to check with the experts (aka you guys)!
Posts.Signature: Age: 36 (29 at diagnosis) Diagnosis: Burkitt's lymphoma, sporadic type (originally misdiagnosed as FL, then DLBCL) Stage: 2B, bulky disease Treatment: Began 8 cycles of R-CHOP 14 on 21 May 2010 + protocol. Discontinued treatment after 6 cycles due to misdiagnosis and switched to 3 cycles of R-CODOX-M/R-IVAC on 20 August 2010. Ended treatment with BEAM+Autologous SCT on 1 October 2010. In remission ever since. My story: [url]http://www.cancerforums.net/threads/13165-NHL-at-29-years-old-My-story[/url]
Posts.Title: Question for the Aussies

Posts.Content: Thanks CM for the reassuring words about North Shore. However, the theory now is that it is NOT the skin cancer (which she has a history of) but rather breast cancer, which has metastasized. So no skin cancer. But I guess Royal North Shore is still a solid facility for breast cancer as well?
